title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Everything you need to know about qHaul

faqs.question: What is qHaul?
faqs.answer: qHaul is a complete transport management system designed for haulage operators. It covers everything from job booking and dispatch to driver apps, real-time tracking, and automated invoicing. It's built specifically for the Irish and UK transport industry.

faqs.question: When will qHaul be available?
faqs.answer: qHaul is currently in development and scheduled for launch in Q2 2025. Register your interest to be notified when we launch and get early access to the platform.

faqs.question: Who is qHaul designed for?
faqs.answer: qHaul is designed for haulage companies of all sizes — from owner-operators with a few vehicles to large fleets with multiple depots. It's built for transport managers, dispatchers, drivers, and anyone involved in the daily operations of a haulage business.

faqs.question: How is qHaul different from other TMS systems?
faqs.answer: qHaul is built from the ground up for the Irish and UK market. We understand local requirements, common workflows, and the real challenges of running a haulage business. Plus, we integrate seamlessly with qMechanic for complete fleet management.

faqs.question: What features will qHaul include at launch?
faqs.answer: At launch, qHaul will include: job booking and management, smart dispatch, driver mobile app with POD capture, real-time GPS tracking, customer portal, rate management, invoicing, and comprehensive reporting.

faqs.question: Will there be a mobile app for drivers?
faqs.answer: Yes, qHaul Driver is a dedicated mobile app for drivers. It shows job details, provides turn-by-turn navigation, enables digital proof of delivery with photos and signatures, and keeps drivers connected with dispatch in real-time.

faqs.question: Can customers track their deliveries?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. qHaul includes a customer portal where your customers can book jobs, view job history, and track active deliveries in real-time. You can also send them direct tracking links for specific deliveries.

faqs.question: Does qHaul support multi-drop routes?
faqs.answer: Yes, qHaul fully supports multi-drop routes. You can create complex delivery routes with multiple collection and delivery points, and the system will help optimize the sequence for efficiency.

faqs.question: Will qHaul integrate with accounting software?
faqs.answer: Yes, we're planning integrations with popular accounting packages including Sage, QuickBooks, and Xero. Invoice data will sync automatically, reducing double-entry and improving cash flow visibility.

faqs.question: Does qHaul integrate with qMechanic?
faqs.answer: Yes, qHaul and qMechanic are designed to work together seamlessly. Vehicle data, compliance status, and defect information flow between the systems automatically, giving you complete visibility of your fleet.

faqs.question: What about telematics integration?
faqs.answer: qHaul will integrate with major telematics providers including Samsara, Webfleet, and Masternaut. This allows real-time vehicle tracking without additional hardware if you already have telematics installed.

faqs.question: Is there an API available?
faqs.answer: Yes, qHaul will include a comprehensive REST API for custom integrations. This allows you to connect qHaul with your existing systems, whether that's a custom TMS, warehouse management system, or any other software.

faqs.question: How much will qHaul cost?
faqs.answer: qHaul will be priced per user, per month. We're planning three tiers: Starter (€25/user), Professional (€45/user), and Enterprise (custom pricing). Early registrations may receive special launch pricing.

faqs.question: How can I register my interest?
faqs.answer: You can register your interest using the form on our website. We'll keep you updated on development progress and notify you as soon as qHaul is ready for early access.

faqs.question: Will there be a beta program?
faqs.answer: Yes, we're planning a beta program before general availability. Register your interest to be considered for early access. Beta users will help shape the final product and receive preferential pricing.

faqs.question: What support will be available?
faqs.answer: All plans will include email support and access to our knowledge base. Professional and Enterprise plans include priority support with faster response times. Enterprise customers get dedicated account managers.
